headline: Airline execs grilled on 'junk fees' in testy Senate hearing: 'Travelers are quite simply fed up'
summary: Airline executives defended their business practices in heated exchanges with lawmakers over ancillary travel fees.

headline: United, Spirit, and other airline execs defend alleged 'junk fees'
summary: Airline executives from Frontier Airlines (ULCC), Spirit Airlines (SAVEQ), United Airlines (UAL), American Airlines (AAL), and Delta Air Lines (DAL) testify in front of the Senate to defend themselves against accusations of using so-called junk fees to drive their revenue. Wealth! Host Brad Smith outlines what investors need to know. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Wealth here. This post was written by Naomi Buchanan.

headline: Is UAL's Cheap Valuation an Opportunity to Invest in the Stock?
summary: Improving demand and lower fuel prices make us optimistic about UAL stock. The company's shareholder-friendly approach & attractive valuation add to its appeal.

headline: United Launches New Seasonal Hub Just in the (Saint) Nick of Time: The North Pole
summary: The holidays are always a Claus for celebration and ahead of what's expected to be the busiest travel period, United Airlines announced today the launch of its newest seasonal hub – the "North Pole" (JOY). United will transport deserving children and their families to the North Pole with direct "Fantasy Flights" from 13 cities around the globe and take the holiday spirit to new heights.

headline: Why Shares of United Airlines Rose 23.7% in November
summary: United Airlines (NASDAQ: UAL) rose by a whopping 23.7% in November, according to data from S&P Global Market Intelligence.  Based on the history of previous administrations, the new Trump administration is seen as one that will take a less stringent approach to merger-and-acquisition activity in the airline industry.  The airline industry's history tells the story of a business that continually fails to generate a return on invested capital (RoIC) to cover its cost of capital.
